text: this recipe for bacon and scallion
quiche is made in a pie plate I have a
9-inch pie plate and a half recipe of
the classic quiche crust so this dough
has been chilling it's ready to roll
roll out to about 11 inches
turning it as I work so that it doesn't
stick roll it up on the pin and then
drape it right over the pie plate turn
any little bit of overhang under and
press it onto the edge use a spoon to
decorate just mark two little half moons
all the way around the crust it makes
for a very pretty edge okay great this
is ready to go into the freezer for 30
minutes at least or up to three days so
here is our frozen crust nice and firm
place parchment paper on top and some
dried beans these will help weight down
the dough while the crust is baking this
will go into a 400-degree oven for 20
minutes and then remove the parchment
and the weights and continue baking for
another 8 to 10 minutes until it's even
golden brown
here's our perfectly baked and cooled
crust the bottom is nice and flat and
edges are a bit golden so now it's time
for the custard three eggs whisk
together add in 3/4 of a cup of whole
milk and heavy cream
the recored is a teaspoon of coarse salt
and a quarter teaspoon of pepper
so that's the classic custard once
submix
pour it right into the shell I have four
slices of cooked and crumbled bacon and
then three scallions thinly sliced
scatter right on top bake at 375 degrees
for 10 minutes reduce the oven to 325
and bake just until the center is set
about 30 minutes more here's our baked
bacon and scallion quiche it's been
cooling for about an hour or two and I
definitely think it's best to eat in the
day it's made although it is good cold
the next morning from the fridge as well
give it a try
